story.asA: a new user who has just verified my email
story.iWant: to complete a guided 5-step onboarding process
story.soThat: the AI can gather my preferences and generate my first personalized plan

group.title: Frontend (AC #1, #2)
group.task: Create reusable components for question prompts and selection controls.
Maintain onboarding state across all 5 steps (goal → diet → persona, etc.).
Ensure that only authenticated and email-verified users can access onboarding.
On completion, send collected preferences to the backend using the authenticated user's JWT.

group.title: Backend (AC #3)
group.task: Implement a `PUT /api/v1/users/profile/` endpoint for storing onboarding preferences.
Require a valid Supabase JWT (user must be authenticated).
Update the corresponding fields in the Supabase `user_profile` table.

group.title: Database (AC #3)
group.task: Confirm that fields exist to store: `fitness_goal`, `dietary_preference`, `fitness_persona`

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: Given I have verified my email and logged in, When I start the onboarding process, Then I am presented with a sequence of five distinct UI screens for collecting preferences.
And I can select my primary fitness goal, dietary preferences, and a “fitness persona.”
And when I complete the final step, all selected preferences are securely saved to my user profile in the Supabase database.

doc.title: ibe160 - Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: As a new user who has just verified my email, I want to complete a guided 5-step onboarding process, So the AI can gather my preferences and generate my first personalized plan.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Epic 1
doc.snippet: Upon verified login, user is redirected to onboarding flow (`src/app/(auth)`). User provides fitness goal, dietary preferences, and fitness persona across 5 steps. Frontend calls `/api/v1/users/profile/` (PUT) to save preferences.

doc.snippet: Users can edit their primary fitness goal and core dietary preference.

artifact.reason: Reference for UI components and form handling. Onboarding will have a similar structure.
Provides the Supabase client for all frontend-to-Supabase interactions. Must be reused.
The FastAPI router where the new PUT endpoint for updating user profiles will be added.

constraints.constraint: Onboarding UI must be implemented under `frontend/src/app/(auth)/onboarding/`.
Must reuse existing authenticated-user session handling patterns from Story 1.3.
All user data interactions must go through Supabase. No local database storage.
API endpoints must be plural nouns and kebab-case (e.g., /api/v1/workout-plans).
All dates and times in API requests and responses must be formatted as ISO 8601 strings in UTC.

tests.standards: Backend tests use Pytest. Frontend tests use React Testing Library with Jest. There is a known issue with Jest/JSDOM from a previous story, so new Jest tests should avoid unnecessary complexity.

ideas.idea: Frontend integration test to verify the 5-step UI flow renders correctly and state persists across steps.
Backend API integration test for the `PUT /api/v1/users/profile/` endpoint to ensure it requires a valid JWT, validates payloads, and updates the database correctly.
End-to-End (Playwright) test to simulate the full flow: login, complete all 5 onboarding steps, submit, and verify the profile is updated in Supabase.
